intro: Boehmeria sylvatica, commonly known as mountain nettle, is a flowering plant native to Asia, particularly found in regions of China, Japan, and Korea. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other members commonly known as nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, opposite leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fibrous stems have been historically used in traditional crafts and papermaking due to their strong, silky texture.
